author: Staff Reporter
text:
(Left) A youth rally organised by Election Office in progress on Wednesday; S. Rajamanickam, Deputy Collector (Revenue), plants a sapling at a college —Photos: S.S. Kumar and special arrangement

Youth take part in rally and distribute pamphlets on voting

The Elections department on Wednesday organised a voter’s awareness campaign at Sri Manakular Vinayagar College of Engineering. B. Thillaivel, Deputy District Election Officer and S. Rajamanickam, Deputy Collector (Revenue) South-cum-Returning Officer inaugurated the campaign and distributed pamphlets to students highlighting the need for voter awareness.

Mr. Thillaivel also administered oath to the students on exercising their franchise without fail on May 16. He also urged the students to create awareness among their families, friends and neighbours on the need to exercise the democratic right. A tree plantation drive was also held at the college and a large number of first time voters participated, a press release said.

Meanwhile, a youth rally was also organised by the Elections department in coordination with Nehru Yuva Kendra of the Union Government. District Election Officer and Collector S. Sundaravadivelu flagged off the rally in which a large number of young voters and participants from various states took part and distributed pamphlets to the people highlighting the need for voter awareness.

The rally went through various parts of the city and culminated near the Gandhi Statue on the Beach Road.
title: Students carry the baton of voter awareness
